results.title: No more Hiroshima
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Jacques Vallee and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary film portrait of two survivors of the atomic bomb droped on Hiroshima. They are among the minority of survivors who have decided to risk their careers and marriage prospects by identifying themselves with “Hobusyka”. The film follows them as they travel to New York to represent the Japanese peace movement at the second United Nations Special Session on Disarmament in June 1982. Excellent for senior students.

results.title: No man's land = Nikogarsnja zemlja [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Danis Tanovic, Cedomir Kolar, Frederique Dumas-Zajdela, Marc Baschet, Casablanca, Studio Maj, Noe Productions, Man's Films and Fabrica Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Danis Tanovic, “No man’s land” is an anti-war satire set in 1993, amid the Bosnian Serb war. A group of Bosnian soldiers advance toward Serbian lines in heavy fog; when day breaks they are clearly visible and massacred with the exception of Chiki, who runs to the nearest trench. When the Serbian troop responsible decide to investigate the outcome, only Nino, a novice soldier, survives the mission, and is now trapped in the same trench as Chiki. As the two men trade insults, the power shifts continuously between them and their situation is further complicated by the fact that Chiki has laid a tripped mine under the body of a Serbian soldier, Cera, who as it turns out, is still alive. A solution of kinds presents itself when the United Nations Peacekeeping force intervenes attempting to diffuse the standoff. When an English journalist cottons on to the ensuing drama, she seeks to attain a scoop for the network, which involves deal making and subterfuge. The tragedy of the war, and misfortune of these unfortunate three - a powerful allegory for the state of warfare - is underpinned by a bitterly absurd humour that permeates this thought-provoking and intelligent film that ponders the corruptibility of the UN, journalistic ethics and the futility of combat.

results.title: No love for Johnnie
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and General Film Distributors
results.brief_description: Johnnie Byrne (Peter Finch) is a man with the political ambition to ascend to number one in the Northern country industrial town in which he was raised. Although his party is successful and is voted into office, Johnnie is overlooked for selection. Returning home, dejected, he discovers his wife, Alice had secret political ideas of her own and has left Johnnie to pursue her own ambitions. He begins an affair with a photographers model, but this too, like his political career is absent of love. A strange turn of events sees Alice attempting to rekindle her relationship with Johnnie and his good fortune seems to continue as he is offered a position in cabinet. To Johnnies horror he discovers that the reason why he wasn’t offered the position before was because of Alice’s connections to the Communist Party and Johnnie must ultimately decide between love and his political ambition. Cast also includes Mary Peach, Stanley Holloway, Donald Pleasence and Billie Whitelaw.

results.title: No Fixed Address: on tour
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South, Channel 0-28 and Media World Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary on the British tour of one of Australia’s leading rock bands, No Fixed Address, a band committed to expressing aspects of their culture and the condition of Aboriginal people through their music. Includes footage of the Brisbane Commonwealth Games protests and also examines British black music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Tatoulis, Colin South, Channel 0-28 and Media World Productions

results.title: Justin de Marseille
results.brief_description:
Justin is the boss of a drug trafficking gang who enjoys a great popularity for also offering protection to the poor. But Esposito, his old time rival, has sworn to eliminate him.

Credits: Director, Maurice Tourneur ; writer, Carlo Rim ; photography, Georges Benoit, Rene Colas ; music, Vincent Scotto, Jacques Ibert.
Cast: Berval, Ghislaine Bru, Pierre Larquey, Alexandre Rignault, Line Noro.

results.title: Just weeds
results.creator_credit: Sol Dworkin, Evelyn Spice and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spread by water and wind, by birds and man’s carelessness, weeds cost the Canadian farmer over one hundred million dollars each year. Several varieties of common weeds are identified, with a warning against the danger from each. Control measures such as the use of clean seed, special crops, sheep grazing, cutting and spraying are illustrated and, throughout, proper cultivation is shown as the basic remedy.

results.title: No nukes
results.creator_credit: Julian Schlossberg, Anthony Potenza, Danny Goldberg and MUSE
results.brief_description: MUSE, (Musicians United for Safe Energy) is a group of musicians and activists working together to put an end to the threat of nuclear weapons and power plants. This video captures one of the many concerts performed by MUSE and takes place at Madison Square Garden in the US in 1980. The “No Nukes Concert” starred Jackson Browne, Crosby, Stills and Nash, The Doobie Brothers, John Hall, Graham Nash, Bonnie Raitt, Gil Scott-Heron, Carly Simon, Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band, James Taylor and Jesse Colin Young and includes among the 20 songs performed “Mockingbird” (James Taylor and Carly Simon), “Running on empty” (Jackson Browne) “Thunder road” and “The River” (Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band. The documentary footage was directed by Barbara Kopple and Haskell Wexler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julian Schlossberg, Anthony Potenza, Danny Goldberg and MUSE

results.title: No more west
results.creator_credit: Nick Grinde, RKO Radio Pictures and Educational Pictures
results.brief_description: Starring comedian Bert Lahr who played the cowardly lion in the Wizard of Oz with Judy Garland. A comic story set in the wild wild west featuring Bert Lahr as the sheriff who finds himself unwittingly facing court for robbing a bank when he was supposed to be out catching the actual bank robbers.

results.title: No more Hibakusha!
results.creator_credit: Audrey Schirmer, Martin Duckworth, Jacques Vallee and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Hibakusha is the Japanese word for the survivors of the American bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. This powerful and moving documentary focuses on a few of the eighty hibakusha who journeyed from Japan to New York in June, 1982, to take part in peace demonstrations held to coincide with the Second United Nations Special Session on Disarmament. They came to urge the nations of the world to prevent nuclear war. Instead of concentrating on the physical suffering of the victims, the film reveals the mental anguish of the hibakusha, who are still haunted by nightmares. Inspired by “Hibakusha”, a book of photographs by Ittetsu Morishita. (Awards: Tokyo, Leipzig)

results.title: No maps on my taps
results.brief_description: A tribute to jazz tap dancing as an expression of black heritage and culture through the portraits of three surviving dancers - Sandman Sims, Chuck Green and Bunny Briggs - combined with rare photos and film clips from the thirties, the heyday of tap. Contains B&W sequences.
results.description: A tribute to jazz tap dancing as an expression of black heritage and culture through the portraits of three surviving dancers - Sandman Sims, Chuck Green and Bunny Briggs - combined with rare photos and film clips from the thirties, the heyday of tap. Contains B&W sequences.
